entries: Du erlernst bestimmte Exploits auf den in der untenstehenden Tabelle angegebenen Stufen des Kämpfers. Sie zählen nicht zu deiner Gesamtzahl an bekannten Exploits und können nicht gewechselt werden, wenn du eine Stufe aufsteigst.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Physique
entries: Your battle-hardened physique allows you to shrug off blows that would send a normal person reeling. You can use your Constitution, in place of Dexterity, when calculating your Armor Class in light and medium armor. Moreover, when you are not wearing armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier.
Lastly, whenever you take damage from a source you can see, you can use {@optfeature brace up|LLExploits} as a reaction, gaining the temporary hit points before you take any damage.

subclassFeature.name: Counter Punch
entries: You have learned to exploit every opening your foes give you. When a creature you can see misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make an unarmed strike, shove, grapple, or improvised weapon attack against it.
If you use force a creature to make a saving throw as part of this reaction attack, it has disadvantage on its roll.

subclassFeature.name: Resolute Strikes
entries: The grit that only comes from a life on the streets fuels your fists. Your unarmed strikes and improvised weapon attacks count as magical for overcoming resistance and immunity.

subclassFeature.name: Evasive Footwork
entries: You have trained to evade your foes' strikes in combat. When you take the Attack action on your turn and make at least one unarmed strike, grapple, or shove, you also gain the benefits of the Disengage action until the end of that turn.

subclassFeature.name: Diamond Physique
entries: You have learned to take hits that would be deadly to weaker warriors. When you use brace up with your reaction, you also gain resistance to that instance of damage.

You also learn the {@optfeature Unbreakable|LLExploits} Exploit, but it doesn't count against your total number of Exploits Known, and you cannot replace it with another Exploit when you gain a level.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Pugilist
entries: Your name is known in the underbelly of every city. You have advantage on saving throws to resist and end being Incapacitated, Paralyzed, or Stunned.
Finally, whenever you score a critical hit with an unarmed strike or improvised weapon, the target falls prone and is Stunned until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Witchblade
entries: Those who walk the dark path of the Witchblade are driven by an overwhelming desire to destroy the great evils of the world. Those especially dedicated, those willing to give up anything, are often approached by Eldritch Powers, beings of otherworldly might. These benefactors offer power in return for a fraction of the warrior's soul or unquestioning fealty.

subclassFeature.name: Pact Magic
entries: Die Abmachung, die du mit deinem Patron getroffen hast, hat dir die Fähigkeit verliehen, Zauber zu wirken, ähnlich wie ein Hexenmeister es tut.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn one cantrip of your choice from the {@filter Witchblade spell list|spells|subclass=Alternate Fighter: Witchblade (LLAF:E)|level=0}. Upon reaching 10th level in this class you learn one additional warlock cantrip of your choice.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Witchblade Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have, and the level of those spell slots. All of your spell slots from this feature are the same level. To cast one of your witchblade spells of 1st-level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You learn two 1st-level spells of your choice from the  {@filter Witchblade spells|spells|subclass=Alternate Fighter: Witchblade (LLAF:E)}. The Spells Known column of the Witchblade Spellcasting table shows when you learn more warlock spells of 1st-level or higher. A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level.
When you gain a level, you can choose a witchblade spell you know and replace it with another spell from the witchblade spell list, which must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma ist deine Zauberfähigkeit für deine Warlock-Zauber. Du verwendest dein Charisma immer dann, wenn sich ein Zauber auf deine Zauberfähigkeit bezieht, wenn du den DC für Rettungswürfe festlegst und wenn du einen Angriffswurf mit einem Zauber machst.

subclassFeature.name: Sanguine Offering
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can offer your own vitality to increase the damage. You take necrotic damage equal to your Exploit Die and deal bonus necrotic damage equal to twice your Exploit Die.
The necrotic damage you take can't be reduced in any way.

subclassFeature.name: War Magic
entries: You can seamlessly weave minor spells with weapon attacks. When you use your action to cast a Witchblade spell you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action on that turn.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Step
entries: Drawing on your eldritch power allows you to slip through cracks in reality. Whenever you cast a Witchblade spell with a casting time of one action or use your Second Wind, you can teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Offering
entries: You restore your vitality by inflicting pain on your foes. When you use Sanguine Offering, you can gain temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt to the creature. However, temporary hit points from this feature only last for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Witchblade
entries: You can offer the souls of your foes to your Eldritch Power in return for increased vitality. When a creature you can see within 30 feet is slain, you can use your reaction to teleport to an unoccupied space of within 5 feet of the slain creature, plunge your weapon into it, and gain temporary hit points equal to twice the slain creature's Challenge Rating.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiling Shot
entries: The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it takes psychic damage equal to twice your Exploit Die and until the start of your next turn, it is Charmed by a creature of your choice that it can see. This effect instantly ends if you or your allies do anything harmful or hostile toward it.

optionalfeature.name: Bursting Shot
entries: The target and all creatures within 10 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they take your choice of cold, fire, or lighting damage equal to twice your Exploit Die.

optionalfeature.name: Enfeebling Shot
entries: The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes necrotic damage equal to twice your Exploit Die and for 1 minute its weapon attacks deal half damage.
The creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Grasping Shot
entries: The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it takes piercing damage equal to twice your Exploit Die and for 1 minute it is bound by thorns. For the duration, its speed is halved, and the first time it uses its speed to move on each turn it takes piercing damage equal to twice your Exploit Die.
A creature can end this effect by using its action to make a successful Strength check against your Exploit save DC.

optionalfeature.name: Piercing Shot
entries: The target, and creatures directly behind it in a straight line out to 30 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take force damage equal to twice your Exploit Die.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Shot
entries: In place of an attack, you use this Enchanted Shot to cause a piece of ammunition you are holding to magically seek out a creature that you have seen within the last minute.

If that creature is within 120 feet and there is a clear path to it (it need not be straight), it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it takes force damage equal to twice your Exploit Die and you instantly learn its location.

optionalfeature.name: Umbral Shot
entries: The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, it takes psychic damage equal to twice your Exploit Die and for 1 minute it is Blinded by visual hallucinations.
The creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Banishing Shot
entries: The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it is banished to a harmless demiplane for 1 minute.
The creature can use its action to repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. When it ends, it reappears in the unoccupied space closest to the space that it left.

optionalfeature.name: Severing Shot
entries: The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes force damage equal to twice your Exploit Die and it cannot cast spells for 1 minute.
The creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Technical Shot
entries: The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it suffers the effects of one Martial Exploit you know, even if the Exploit could normally only be used with a melee attack.

optionalfeature.name: Transposing Shot
entries: The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, it takes force damage equal to twice your Exploit Die and you switch places with it without provoking opportunity attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Cloud Rune
entries: This Rune imbues the cunning magic of Cloud Giants. This Rune's wielder knows the {@optfeature subtle con|LLExploits} Exploit.

entries.name: Invoke
entries: When you or a creature you can see within 30 feet is targeted by an attack, you can use your reaction to Invoke this Rune to redirect the triggering attack at another target within its reach, other then itself.

optionalfeature.name: Fire Rune
entries: This Rune imbues the fury of Fire Giants. This Rune's wielder knows the {@optfeature commanding presence|LLExploits} Exploit.

entries.name: Invoke
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can Invoke this Rune to conjure restraints of molten metal around it. It takes bonus fire damage equal to twice your Exploit Die and must succeed on a Strength saving throw. On a failure, it is Restrained for 1 minute.
While Restrained it takes fire damage equal to twice your Exploit Die at the start of each of its turns. As an action, it can repeat the saving throw, ending this effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Frost Rune
entries: This Rune imbues the primeval instincts of the Frost Giants. This Rune's wielder knows the {@optfeature cunning instinct|LLExploits} Exploit.

entries.name: Invoke
entries: As a bonus action, you can Invoke this Rune to empower your body. For 10 minutes, your speed increases by 10 feet, and you gain a bonus to all Strength and Constitution ability checks and saving throws equal to your Exploit Die.
You can Invoke this Rune as part of using Runic Might.

optionalfeature.name: Hill Rune
entries: This Rune imbues the stalwart power of the Hill Giants. The Rune's wielder knows the {@optfeature hurl|LLExploits} and {@optfeature mighty thrust|LLExploits} Exploits.

entries.name: Invoke
entries: As a bonus action, you Invoke this Rune and gain resistance to all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute. This effect ends early if you are Incapacitated.
You can Invoke this Rune as part of using Runic Might.

optionalfeature.name: Stone Rune
entries: This Rune imbues the dreamlike magic of the Stone Giants. This Rune's wielder knows the {@optfeature inquisitive eye|LLExploits} Exploit.

entries.name: Invoke
entries: When a creature you can see ends its turn within 30 feet of you, can use your reaction to Invoke this Rune and force it to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, for the next minute, it is in a waking dream, has a speed of 0, and is Incapacitated. It repeats this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending these effects on a successful save.

optionalfeature.name: Storm Rune
entries: This Rune imbues the prophetic magic of Storm Giants. The wielder knows the {@optfeature mighty leap|LLExploits} and {@optfeature scholarly recall|LLExploits} Exploits.

entries.name: Invoke
entries: As a bonus action, you Invoke this Rune to enter a prophetic state that lasts for 1 minute. For its duration, when a creature you can see within 60 feet makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to add or subtract your Exploit Die from the creature's roll.
Maintaining the prophetic state of this Rune requires your concentration as if you were concentrating on a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Fortifying Ration
entries: {@note Duration: 1 minute}

Upon consumption, the creature chooses either its Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution. For the duration, the creature can add your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1) to any ability check or saving throw with the chosen ability score.

optionalfeature.name: Invigorating Ration
entries: {@note Duration: instantaneous}
Upon consumption, the creature regains hit points equal to twice your Exploit Die + your Constitution modifier.
At 10th level, hit points restored that exceed the target's hit point maximum become temporary hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Revitalizing Ration
entries: {@note Duration: instantaneous}

Nach dem Verzehr beendet die Kreatur einen der folgenden Zustände, von denen sie gerade betroffen ist: {@condition blinded|phb|blindness}, {@condition deafened|phb|deafness}, {@condition poisoned|phb|poison}, oder sie reduziert ihre {@condition exhaustion} Stufe um 1.
Ab der 10. Stufe kann diese Ration auch die Zustände {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed} und {@condition stunned} heilen.

optionalfeature.name: Stimulating Ration
entries: {@note Duration: instantaneous}

Diese Ration muss im Rahmen einer kurzen Rast konsumiert werden. Nach dem Verzehr erhält die Kreatur einen Vorteil auf den Wurf für alle Trefferwürfel, die sie während dieser kurzen Ruhepause ausgeben möchte.

Ab der 10. Stufe erlaubt der Verzehr dieser Ration der Kreatur, alle Trefferwürfel, die sie während der kurzen Ruhepause verbraucht, als ihr maximal mögliches Ergebnis zu behandeln, anstatt zu würfeln.

optionalfeature.name: Limbering Ration
entries: {@note Duration: 1 minute}
Upon consumption, the creature's speed increases by 10 feet.
At 10th level, the creature's speed increases by 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Thickening Ration
entries: {@note Duration: 1 minute}
Upon consumption, the creature gains resistance to either bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (its choice).
At 10th level, consuming this Ration grants it resistance to all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Engorgening Ration
entries: {@note Duration: 1 minute}

Upon consumption, the creature becomes Large if it was not already. For the duration, its reach increases by 5 feet, it has advantage on Strength checks and saving throws, and its melee weapon attacks it makes deal a bonus 1d4 damage.

optionalfeature.name: Heightening Ration
entries: {@note Duration: 1 minute}

Upon consumption, the creature chooses either Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma. For the duration, the creature can add your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1) to ability checks and saving throws with the chosen ability score.

optionalfeature.name: Warding Ration
entries: {@note Duration: 1 minute}
Nach dem Verzehr erhält die Kreatur 1 Minute lang Widerstand gegen Säure-, Kälte-, Feuer-, Gift-, Blitz- oder Donnerschaden (nach ihrer Wahl).
Auf der 10. Stufe erhöht sich die Dauer des Effekts auf 1 Stunde, und die Kreatur kann zusätzlich zu den anderen Schadensarten zwischen Kraft-, Nekrotik-, Psycho- oder Strahlenschaden wählen.

optionalfeature.name: Berserker Ration
entries: {@note Duration: 1 minute}

Nach dem Verzehr fällt die Kreatur für die nächste Stunde nicht {@condition unconscious}, wenn sie auf 0 Trefferpunkte reduziert wird. Sie macht jedoch weiterhin normale Rettungswürfe und stirbt bei drei Fehlversuchen.

optionalfeature.name: Rejuvenating Ration
entries: {@note Duration: instant}

Upon consumption, the creature instantly gains the benefits of a short rest, including the ability to expend Hit Dice. At the end of its current turn, it gains 1 level of Exhaustion that can only be reduced by magic or completing a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Featherweight Schematic
entries: You modify the metallurgic makeup of the object, making it significantly lighter and grating it the following benefits:

entries.name: Boots
entries: The wearer ignores the effects of mundane difficult terrain and its walking speed increases by 10 feet.

entries.name: Heavy Armor
entries: The wearer ignores penalties to Dexterity (Stealth) checks or Strength requirements of this armor.

entries.name: Light Armor
entries: The wearer does not take falling damage if they fall less than 100 feet, and when falling at least 10 feet, they can move horizontally 2 feet for every 1 foot they fall.

entries.name: Weapon
entries: It loses the heavy and two-handed traits if it had them, and if it did not, it gains the light and finesse traits.

optionalfeature.name: Intuitive Schematic
entries: You modify an object so that it enhances the bearers tactical instincts in combat, granting the following benefits:

entries.name: Helm
entries: The wearer gains a bonus to any Investigation or Perception checks it makes equal to your Exploit Die.

entries.name: Light or Medium Armor
entries: The wearer uses its Intelligence, in place of its Dexterity for initiative rolls, and for calculating its Armor Class while wearing this armor.

entries.name: Melee Weapon
entries: The wielder uses its Intelligence, in place of its Strength or Dexterity, for both attack and damage rolls with this modified weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Radiant Schematic
entries: You modify an object to absorbs ambient light. The bearer of an object modified by this Schematic can use a bonus action to cause the object to emit (or extinguish) bright light out to a 15-foot radius, and dim light 15 feet beyond that. If the object was exposed to sunlight in the past day, this light is sunlight.
The object also gains three Charges, which it regains at the end of each long rest, which fuel the following abilities:

entries.name: Armor or Shield
entries: When the bearer of this object is hit by an attack, it can expend one Charge to force the attacker to make a Constitution saving throw if it is within 15 feet. On a failure, it is Blinded for 1 minute. It repeats this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Melee Weapon
entries: When the wielder hits a creature with this weapon, it can expend one Charge to force the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is Blinded for 1 minute. It repeats this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Rebounding Schematic
entries: You modify an object's makeup with pulleys, cords, or elastic properties which grant it the following benefits:

entries.name: Boots
entries: If the wearer runs 10 feet in a straight line, it can use its bonus action to expend to long jump up to 30 feet in a line, even if this distance would exceed its remaining speed. It also adds your Intelligence modifier to its high jump distance.

entries.name: Heavy Armor
entries: When the wearer is hit by a melee attack, it can use its reaction to reduce the damage by your Exploit Die + your Intelligence modifier. If it reduces the damage to 0, the attack is reflected and deals full damage to the attacker.

entries.name: Non-Heavy Weapon
entries: It gains the Thrown (20/40) property, and after making a thrown attack with this weapon, it returns to its wielders hand instantly.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Schematic
entries: You modify an object with clockwork mechanics that improve both power and reflexes, granting the following benefits:

entries.name: Heavy Armor
entries: The wearer can use your Intelligence score, in place of its Strength, for any Strength-based ability checks or Strength saving throws that it makes.

entries.name: Light Armor
entries: The wearer can use your Intelligence score, in place of its Dexterity, for any Dexterity-based ability checks or Dexterity saving throws that it makes, including initative.

entries.name: Weapon
entries: When the wielder hits a target with this weapon, it can treat any of the weapon's damage dice as their average roll if they rolled lower: d4 (2), d6 (3), d8 (4), d10 (5), d12 (6).

optionalfeature.name: Resilient Schematic
entries: You modify the metallurgical makeup of this item to make it more resilient, granting the following benefits:

entries.name: Armor
entries: The wearer is resistant to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. If this modifies a magic set of armor, it grants resistance to magical damage of those types.

entries.name: Helm
entries: The wearer has advantage on any saving throws it makes to resist the Stunned or Incapacitated conditions or to maintain its concentration on a spell or similar effect.

entries.name: Weapon
entries: When the wielder hits a Large or smaller target with this weapon, the target is knocked backward 5 feet in a straight line, so long as the space behind it is unoccupied.

trait.name: Hit Dice
entries: Dein Jagdhund hat eine Gesamtzahl von {@dice d8} Trefferwürfeln, die deiner Kämpferstufe entspricht. Außerdem erhält er alle normalen Vorteile von kurzen und langen Pausen.

trait.name: Loyal
entries: While you are within 30 feet of it, the Hound adds your PB to any ability check or saving throw it is forced to make and it cannot be Frightened.

trait.name: Keen Hearing & Smell
entries: The Hound has advantage on ability checks that incorporate its hearing or smell.

trait.name: Strong Jaws
entries: If the Hound hits a creature equal to its size or smaller with its Bite, it can grapple the target in its jaws. While grappling it can't Bite other targets.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +2 + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 2 + PB} piercing damage.

trait.name: Hit Dice
entries: Dein Jagdhund hat eine Gesamtzahl von {@dice d8} Trefferwürfeln, die deiner Kämpferstufe entspricht. Außerdem erhält er alle normalen Vorteile von kurzen und langen Pausen.

trait.name: Loyal
entries: While you are within 30 feet of it, the Hound adds your PB to any ability check or saving throw it is forced to make and it cannot be Charmed.

trait.name: Keen Hearing & Smell
entries: The Hound has advantage on ability checks that incorporate its hearing or smell.

trait.name: Strong Jaws
entries: If the Hound hits a creature equal to its size or smaller with its Bite, it can grapple the target in its jaws. While grappling it can't Bite other targets.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d6 + 11} piercing damage.

trait.name: Dark Bond
entries: If your If your Shade is forced to make a saving throw it uses your saving throw bonus for the roll.Shade is forced to make a saving throw it uses your saving throw bonus for the roll.

trait.name: Incorporeal Echo
entries: The Shade has no physical presence, but its space counts as difficult terrain. It cannot use or interact with objects or magic items.

trait.name: Umbral Guardian
entries: If a creature provokes an opportunity attack from the Shade, you can use your reaction to make an opportunity attack from the Shade's space.

feat.name: Alternate Defensive Duelist
entries: When a creature you can see hits you with a melee attack while you are wielding a finesse or light melee weapon you are proficient with, you can use your reaction to add your Dexterity modifier to your Armor Class against that attack.
When you use this reaction and the attack misses, you can make a single melee weapon attack against your attacker as part of the same reaction.

feat.name: Alternate Fighting Initiate
entries: You have dedicated time to master a specific style of fighting. When you select this Feat you gain the following benefits:

items: You learn one {@filter Fighting Style from those available to the Alternate Fighter|optionalfeatures|feature type=fs:af}. You cannot learn the same Fighting Style more then once. In order to learn a Fighting Style you must meet any prerequisites it has.

feat.name: Alternate Great Weapon Master
entries: You have honed your skills with massive weapons to overwhelm your foes. You gain the following benefits:

items: If you reduce a creature to 0 hit points or score a critical hit with a heavy melee weapon you can use a bonus action on that turn to make one attack with that same weapon.

Whenever you hit a creature that is equal to your size or smaller with a heavy melee weapon attack you can knock it back 5 feet away from you in a line, so long as the space that is behind it is unoccupied.

feat.name: Martial Training
entries: You have studied the combat techniques of elite warriors. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn two 1st-degree {@filter Martial Exploits|optionalfeatures|feature type=ll:1de;ll:me=sand}from those available to the Alternate Fighter. If an Exploit you use requires the target to make a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier.
You gain two d4 Exploit Dice to fuel your Exploits. They are expended when you use them, and you regain them when you finish a short or long rest.
If you already have Exploit Dice from another source, you only gain one Exploit Die equal to your other Exploit Dice.

feat.name: Signature Technique
entries: You have practiced a single technique to the point of mastery. Choose a 1st-degree Exploit you know from those available to the Alternate Fighter that does not restore hit points.
In combat, you can use this Exploit once per round without expending an Exploit Die, rolling a d4 for the Exploit Die. You regain this feature at the start of each of your turns.

feat.name: Weapon Adept

prerequisite.other: At least one Martial Exploit Known

entries: You have spent many hours honing your skills with the deadly armaments of war. You gain the benefits listed below:

items: You gain proficiency with all simple and martial weapons.

feat.name: Weapon Master
entries: You wield weapons with a deadly efficiency that is impressive even to most trained warriors. Choose a number of simple or martial weapons equal to your Proficiency Bonus. Whenever you make an attack with those weapons you gain a +1 bonus to both the attack and damage roll.
As your Proficiency Bonus increases, you choose additional weapons to gain this benefit.

entries.name: The Fighter
entries: Der junge Wachmann schlüpfte leise an seinen Kameraden vorbei durch die Hintertür der Waffenkammer, in der sich die Bürger versteckt hielten. Eine Banditenbande war an diesem Morgen plötzlich über ihr Dorf hergefallen, und ihr Anführer hatte eine Herausforderung ausgesprochen. Wenn ein Krieger aus der Stadt ihn im Einzelkampf besiegen könnte, würde seine Banditenbande friedlich abziehen. Obwohl der junge Mensch erst vor einer Saison in die Stadtwache eingetreten war, konnte er bereits jeden anderen Wächter mit dem Schwert schlagen. Zur Überraschung der Stadtbewohner zog er sein Schwert, murmelte ein Gebet und trat vor, um sein Haus zu verteidigen.

Eine ergraute Zwergin überblickte das feindliche Lager, als die Sonne unterzugehen begann. Zusammen mit drei ihrer besten Soldaten hatte sie sich auf den Weg zum Zelt des feindlichen Generals gemacht, mit der Absicht, die Armee in die Flucht zu schlagen oder bei dem Versuch zu sterben. In einer echten Schlacht hätte die kleine Zwergenschar unter ihrem Kommando keine Chance gegen dieses große Heer gehabt. Wenn jedoch ihre Gruppe von Elitesoldaten ihre Befehle buchstabengetreu befolgte, hatten sie die Chance, den Kopf des Heeres abzuschlagen, bevor es zur Schlacht kam. Für ihre vielleicht letzte Mission ergriff sie ihre Streitaxt und gab den Befehl zum Aufbruch.

Der extravagante elfische Gladiator hielt für einen kurzen Moment inne und genoss den Jubel der Menge. Er erinnerte sich an seinen ersten Gladiatorenkampf in der unterirdischen Arena, umgeben von betrunkenen Piraten und Sklavenhändlern. Jetzt trat er für den König und die Königin inmitten des Trubels der größten Metropole des Königreichs auf. Nachdem er den Moment ausgekostet hatte, wirbelte er herum und stieß seinen vergoldeten Speer in das Herz seines Gegners, was seinen letzten Kampf beendete und ihm seine Freiheit einbrachte.

entries.name: Masters of the Battlefield
entries: Nicht jeder Stadtgardist, Söldner oder Berufssoldat ist ein echter Kämpfer. Ein geborener Kämpfer hat ein angeborenes Kriegstalent und einen ausgeprägten Kampfinstinkt und kann dem Ruf des Schlachtfelds nicht widerstehen. Kämpfer, die aus den Reihen der Militäroffiziere, Elite-Leibwächter, altgedienten Söldner und gesalbten Ritter stammen, sind für ihre meisterhaften Fähigkeiten im Kampf bekannt.

Das Erforschen von Kerkern, das Töten von Monstern und andere gefährliche Arbeiten, die unter Abenteurern üblich sind, sind für einen Kämpfer eine Selbstverständlichkeit. Irgendetwas tief in ihnen zwingt sie, Konflikte zu suchen und sich mitten hinein zu stürzen. Kämpfer sind oft Meister des fairen Wettbewerbs und loyale Verbündete.

entries.name: The Armaments of War
entries: Jeder Kämpfer kann eine Axt schwingen, mit einem Rapier fechten, einen Feind mit einem Langschwert niederstrecken und einen Bogen mit einem hohen Maß an Geschicklichkeit benutzen. Ebenso ist ein Kämpfer versiert im Umgang mit Schilden und jeder Art von Rüstung. Kämpfer schwingen die Waffen und Rüstungen ihrer Wahl wie eine Erweiterung ihrer selbst und verwandeln sich auf dem Schlachtfeld in wunderschöne und doch tödliche Wirbel aus geschliffenem Stahl.

Sie sind zwar alle kampferprobt, aber die Art der Ausbildung eines Kämpfers kann sehr unterschiedlich sein. Einige kultivieren eine immense körperliche Kraft und zerschmettern ihre Feinde mit überwältigenden Schlägen. Andere ziehen es vor, aus der Ferne zuzuschlagen und ihre Feinde zu töten, bevor sie sich ihrer Anwesenheit bewusst sind. Andere nutzen taktische Kenntnisse, um ihre Verbündeten zu koordinieren. Und einige wenige ergänzen ihre kämpferischen Fähigkeiten mit begrenzten, aber mächtigen arkanen Zaubern.

entries.name: Creating Your Fighter
entries: Bei der Erschaffung eines Kämpfers ist es am wichtigsten zu wissen, wo er seine Fähigkeiten im Umgang mit den Waffen des Krieges erworben hat. Bist du der Spross eines Adelshauses und wurdest von Geburt an von den besten Kriegern deiner Familie ausgebildet? Sind Sie ein Gladiator, der zum Spaß gekämpft hat und gezwungen wurde, das Kämpfen zu lernen oder zu sterben? Kommst du aus dem Nichts und verdienst dir als Mitglied einer Söldnertruppe mit der Spitze deines Schwertes Nahrung, Unterkunft und Münzen?

Überlegen Sie auch, welchen Kampfstil Ihr Kämpfer hat und wie er sich von anderen Kriegern unterscheidet. Bist du ein Künstler im Umgang mit deinen Waffen und bewegst dich anmutig über das Schlachtfeld? Bist du besonders rücksichtslos und schwelgst im Chaos und Gemetzel des Krieges? Oder kämpfst du mit Ehre und Respekt und forderst nur diejenigen heraus, die du als ebenbürtig im Umgang mit dem Schwert ansiehst?

entries.name: Multiclassing and the Fighter
entries: Wenn eure Gruppe die optionale Mehrfachklassifizierungsregel anwendet, müsst ihr Folgendes wissen, wenn ihr euch entscheidet, die erste Stufe in der Klasse des Kämpfers zu nehmen.

entries.name: Ability Score Minimum
entries: Als Mehrklassencharakter musst du mindestens einen Stärke- (oder Geschicklichkeits-) Wert von 13 haben, um eine Stufe in dieser Klasse zu nehmen, oder um eine Stufe in einer anderen Klasse zu nehmen, wenn du bereits ein Kämpfer bist.

entries.name: Proficiencies
entries: Wenn der Kämpfer nicht deine ursprüngliche Klasse ist, erhältst du mit deiner ersten Stufe als Kämpfer folgende Fertigkeiten: leichte Rüstung, mittlere Rüstung, Schilde, einfache Waffen und Kampfwaffen.

entries.name: Exploits
entries: Wenn du eine andere Eigenschaft hast, die es dir erlaubt, Exploits zu erlernen und auszuführen, fügst du alle deine Exploit-Würfel zu einem Pool zusammen, und sie werden alle so groß wie dein größter Exploit-Würfel. Du kannst dann jeden dieser Exploit-Würfel benutzen, um alle Exploits auszuführen, die du aus einer der beiden Quellen kennst.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: Mit den folgenden Vorschlägen kannst du schnell einen Kämpfer erstellen. Erstens: Je nachdem, welche Waffen du benutzen willst, ist deine Stärke (schwere Waffen oder Nahkampfwaffen) oder deine Geschicklichkeit (Fernkampfwaffen oder Zweihandwaffen) dein höchster Fähigkeitswert, gefolgt von der Konstitution. Zweitens: Wähle den {@background soldier|phb} Hintergrund.
